info.title: Izanami client API
info.description: This describes client endpoints exposed by Izanami. These endpoints are accessible using an api key. This swagger does not yet include 'admin' endpoints that are used by backoffice.

/api/v2/events.description: Emit Server Sent Events when features in given scope are modified. This endpoint also emit initially (and optionally periodically) a global event that contains state of every feature in scope.

get.description: ⚠️⚠️⚠️ Below model is represented with JSON for OpenAPI convenience, however this endpoinst serves Server Sent Event format (see MDN SSE documentation for details).

post.summary: Suscribe to events and pass a JSON payload (script feature)
post.description: ⚠️⚠️⚠️ Below model is represented with JSON for OpenAPI convenience, however this endpoinst serves Server Sent Event format (see MDN SSE documentation for details).

/api/v2/features/{id}.description: Compute feature activation for given parameters. POST endpoint allows to pass data in body that can be used by script based features.

/api/v2/features.description: These two endpoints allows checking activation for multiple features. Optionally, they can return activation conditions for these features., allowing to recompute their activation offline.

get.description: This endpoint returns both  a body and status code that indicate application health. If status code if 200, Izanami is healthy, if status code is 500 there is something wrong (unreachable database, ...).
This endpoint emits legacy (v1) format event whenever a feature is created / updated / deleted. It also periodically emit keep alive events when nothing happens.

post.summary: Export required data for one tenant

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Version of Izanami instance that exported data

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: Timezone to use for exported dates (only used when importing data from v1)

parameters.name: deduceProject
parameters.description: Only used when importing data from Izanami v1 instance. Indicate whether Izanami should deduce project name from feature name. If set to true, projectPartSize will be used to decide how many feature name part should be used to deduce project. If set to false, imported features will be placed in project indicated by project parameter.

parameters.name: projectPartSize
parameters.description: Only used when importing data from Izanami v1 if deduceProject is set to true.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Only used when importing data from Izanami v1 if deduceProject is set to false.

parameters.name: inlineScript
parameters.description: Whether imported script should be inlined in their feature (as base64) or register to external WASMO instance. If set to false, an external wasmo instance must be configured.

post.summary: Import provided data in provided tenant

200.description: Result of imported file coming from V2 instannce

202.description: Result of imported file coming from V1 instannce. Import from V1 instance can take time, especially if scripts are involved. To know when import is finished, you'll have to poll /api/admin/tenants/{tenant}/_import/id endpoint.

get.summary: Provide information about status of an import

user.name: user
user.description: User for which activation should be computed, this is used by user based conditions (user list, percentage, ...)

context.name: context
context.description: Context to use for computing activation, for subcontext separate context by a '/' character (ex: 'root/subcontext/subsubcontext').

pattern.name: pattern
pattern.description: Pattern to search feature for. For instance pattern foo:* will match for feature 'foo:bar', 'foo:baz:biz' but not 'baz'

page.name: page
page.description: Page to fetch, it starts at 1 (not 0).

features.name: features
features.description: Ids of features to query, activation status will be returned for all these features.

projects.name: projects
projects.description: Ids of projects to query, activation will be returned for every feature of these projects, after applying them tag filters.

conditions.name: conditions
conditions.description: Whether activation condition should be returned alongside feature activations. Conditions are returned for all contexts / subcontexts. These conditions can be used to recompute activation locally, without needing another call. This parameter should not be 'true' if you have no interest in computing activation locally, since it may have a minor impact on response time performances.

date.name: date
date.description: Date for which activation should be computed, used by time based activation conditions. Default is current time.

oneTagIn.name: oneTagIn
oneTagIn.description: When querying projects using 'projects' parameters, feature of these projects are filtered to keep only features with one tag in this tag array. Format is 'tag1,tag2,tag3'.

allTagsIn.name: allTagsIn
allTagsIn.description: When querying projects using 'projects' parameters, feature of these projects are filtered to keep only features with all given tags. Format is 'tag1,tag2,tag3'.

noTagIn.name: noTagIn
noTagIn.description: When querying projects using 'projects' parameters, feature of these projects are filtered to keep only features none of the given tags. Format is 'tag1,tag2,tag3'.

personalAccessToken.name: Authorization
personalAccessToken.description: Personal access token in basic auth format, header value must be "Basic <encodedCredentials>" where encodedCredentials is "<USERNAME>:<TOKEN SECRET>" encoded in Base64
